channel.title: Games for.. Women?
channel.description: Hey guise, So I've recently bought Xbox 360 pad and plugged it to my pc, which is plugged to my HDTV and 5.1.. I quite enjoy playing my games this way. Due to that my fiance asked me recently to get her some games so she can play too. Listen, she's not a gamer kind of person. Gaming with keyboard and mouse is more difficult for her than entertaining. Pad is easier for her to overcome.. Do you guys know of any quite simple yet entertaining games she could try. It doesn't really has to support xbox 360 pad as I have xpadder.. I have basically no idea. Thanks for help. :wink:

item.title: Games for.. Women?
item.dc:creator: JayJay
item.description:
robot_deodorant:

This is actually a good suggestion for game/pc/fps n00bs. Only start with Portal One. And be there through the first stages to help suggest how to get through the tough parts so that she doesn’t get frustrated right off the bat… then eventually let her take over. This can lead to a gamer who’s good with a mouse+keyboard in game.

Yep, this is what my girlfriend and I did. And now I lose my PC privileges over the weekends because she plays Portal 2

Read full topic

item.title: Games for.. Women?
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
Deadline99:

Portal 2.

This is actually a good suggestion for game/pc/fps n00bs. Only start with Portal One. And be there through the first stages to help suggest how to get through the tough parts so that she doesn’t get frustrated right off the bat… then eventually let her take over. This can lead to a gamer who’s good with a mouse+keyboard in game.

item.title: Games for.. Women?
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Merode:

So:
-Easy controls
-2D
-Adventure or Puzzle game (possibly, point and click?)
-Not too brutal, no gore or shit like that

Maybe if I tell you what is her movie taste it will be easier… Her favourite TV series was Prison Break (Shawshank Redemption). In general she likes action/catastrophic/Sci-fi movies mix like: Independence Day, 2012, Knowing, Pitch Black, I Am Legend, Inception…

why didn’t you just say so![/size]

Within a Deep Forest[/size] fits the criteria perfectly, without going so dumb as being a point-and-click.

For the most part, the controls are:* Move Left

  • Move Right
  • Be Bouncier
  • Be Less Bouncy
    You can choose between harder and easier physics, and everything you need to know is explained succinctly in-game. It gradually gets more challenging but you totally move at your own pace. The music is totally relaxing, and it holds the title of being the only multi-difficulty game I’ve gone through in its entirety for each difficulty level. Which is to say, I played it, and then I played it again with the harder physics.

Read full topic

item.title: Games for.. Women?
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
My wife loves Plants vs. Zombies. But beware: You oughta buy a new computer for her, because she won’t let you play. It’s that addictive.

Other games my wife plays: Chime, Zuma’s Revenge (style of games), Defense Grid (Tower Defense style of games), Dragon Age Origins, and now The Witcher 2.

Read full topic
